thread.title: Man arrested after firing rifle during fight in Tigard, police say
thread.title_full: Man arrested after firing rifle during fight in Tigard, police say | OregonLive.com

author: Rebecca Woolington | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Man arrested after firing rifle during fight in Tigard, police say
text:
Gabriel Mendoza-Avila WCSO An argument at a Tigard home ended in a man firing a rifle while two people tried to wrestle the weapon from him early Saturday, according to police.
Gabriel Mendoza-Avila, 24, was arrested on accusations of disorderly conduct, recklessly endangering another and unlawful use of weapon, said Jim Wolf, a Tigard police spokesman. He was booked into the Washington County Jail.
The shooting unfolded shortly before 5:45 a.m. Saturday, after an argument broke out between Mendoza-Avila and a woman outside the home in the 11500 block of Southwest 72nd Avenue , Wolf said. The argument escalated as several people who lived with the woman became involved.
Mendoza-Avila, Wolf said, had shown up at the home with the rile. At some point during the altercation, Mendoza-Avila allegedly fired the gun once as a man and woman struggled to grab the weapon from him, Wolf said. No one was injured.
Minutes later, Tigard police arrived to find a group of people outside yelling, Wolf said. Officers learned that children were inside the residence during the altercation, Wolf said. Police did not find where the rifle bullet landed.
The investigation is continuing.
-- Rebecca Woolington
rwoolington@oregonian.com
